What is the purpose of the `-blockversion=<n>` option in Verus?
The `-blockversion=<n>` option is used to override the block version to test forking scenarios. The default block version is 4.

`-blockversion=<n>`    Override block version to test forking scenarios (default: 4) ## RPC options: `-rpcworkqueue=<n>`    Set the depth of the work queue to service RPC calls (default: 16) `-rpcservertimeout=<n>`    Timeout during HTTP requests (default: 30) compiled by Oink.vrsc@. Note: last revision date 2024-05-03.
